name: Ephrathites of Bethlehem (Elimelech’s clan)
blurb: Clanic designation signaling social location in Judah—roots that make redemption possible through kin lines.

name: Return from Moab (the two widows)
blurb: Homecoming at barley harvest frames providence’s timing—emptiness meets firstfruits.
searchText: return from moab (the two widows) group narrative homecoming at barley harvest frames providence’s timing—emptiness meets firstfruits.

name: Women neighbors name Obed
blurb: Communal naming weaves family joy into civic memory—Naomi’s emptiness publicly reversed.
searchText: women neighbors name obed group narrative communal naming weaves family joy into civic memory—naomi’s emptiness publicly reversed.

name: Naomi (Mara)
blurb: Naomi’s self-renaming to ‘Mara’ (‘bitter’) marks a theological wrestling that becomes a doorway to praise—lament as faithful speech.
searchText: naomi (mara) person narrative naomi’s self-renaming to ‘mara’ (‘bitter’) marks a theological wrestling that becomes a doorway to praise—lament as faithful speech.

name: Do not go empty to your mother-in-law
blurb: Boaz’s pastoral instinct ensures Naomi tastes providence before the legal finish—mercy anticipates resolution.

name: House of Perez (blessing)
blurb: Community invokes Perez as emblem of fruitful, enduring house—scandal redeemed into stability.

name: Protection from harassment
blurb: Boaz orders young men not to touch Ruth—sanctifying the workspace by proactive justice.

name: Spread your garment (wing) over your servant
blurb: Marriage-redemption metaphor invoking God’s protective wings—Ruth’s theology is both tender and precise.

name: Time marker: beginning of barley harvest

name: Water jars and table fellowship in the field
blurb: Boaz extends workplace hospitality—dignity for the foreigner expressed in concrete, ordinary mercies.

name: Witness formula at the gate (‘We are witnesses’)
blurb: Legal chorus that seals redemption and marriage; public memory guards private vows.
